column4: Would anyone like to help me fix Ubuntu 11.10? I just installed it, and it only loads the "waiting for network configuration screen", then it goes black. Any help is very much appreciated!!
why didn't you go for the newer release?
I'm a total noob and it's for a class. I didn't know a newer one was available. using it on vmware vSphere
can I suggest version 12.04  -  there were a number of improvements in that version.
I've been trying to fix it myself, and have read that 12.04 is much better
If I was you, first thing I would do is get 12.04 and start from there. Secondly, what do you see in ifconfig -a
just interested in interface name and IP
I don't see a name or ip address when i typed in ifconfig -a
then you probably don't have a virtual interface configured in VMWare.  Go into VMWare and check the settings you have for you virtual NIc - what do u have?
under the hardware tab in my vm properties for ubuntu, it says "network adapter 1: invalid backing"
u have a known VMWare issue - I'm just looking up the answer on VMWARE.
thank you so much. i've been pulling my hair out looking for answers on there
You need to assign permissions to the virtual switch - check that.
Virtua switch in VMWare I mean.
check Inventory->Networking. You may have forgotten to assign them permissions to the switch.
If you don't have permissions to change the VMswitch config in VMWare, I would recommend you speak to whoever manages that VMHost.
thank you very much for the help anyway!
No problem, as soon as you get your virtual environment sorted, boot Ubuntu again and we can take it from there. Basically your Virtual Ubuntu does not have a working NIC at the moment.
